Gra wydana zostaÅ‚a z okazji Roku Moniuszki.

Name: Паўстанцы (Rebels)
Description:
Historical card game which helps you to return back to the times of 1863 KoÅ›ciuszko Uprising in Belarus. You can take either a role of one of the famous persons (KoÅ›ciuszko himself, Valery UrubleÅ­ski or Mikhail Myravyov) or ordinary Belarusan citizen who still can impact the rebellion progress.

The game is based upon people interactions, pointing out and defending your opinion. Cheating, bluffing, deceiving and butchering one another is a player's right.

Translated from publisher

Name: Iconoclash: LevelMAX
Description:
Iconoclash: LevelMAX is a stand-alone expansion and features 4 new, cross-over fighters for the Iconoclash system from Level 99 Games:


     Zsolt: This relentless hunter never ceases, releasing his flurry of attacks with his arsenal of weapons. There’s no escape!
     Khadath: The master of the portal takes to the battlefield and assumes control. By summoning his Gate Trap he can attack from any range.
     Deques: Is your deck ready and do you want to duel? After studying the meta game for years, Deques has readied his deck of trading cards for any situation. Summon all sorts of monsters to become the champion!
     Esfir: Bring down the house with this hothead who controls gravity. She sends her opponents flying into the stratosphere, creates blackholes, and inverts gravity with a snap of her fingers.


In LevelMAX you'll take the fight to the world of Seventh Cross with Mansion of Darkness and the Gilded Foyer maps.

Name: Cats collection (あつめねこ )
Description:
A large number of cats are coming to the backyard. Show them your yummy foods to invite the cats into your home! However, if your food is not so unique, the cats will go away. Now it's time to choose your foods.

Players use rice cards to collect cats. If you collect the most cats, you will win! The rules are simple, just give out a different card and call a cat! Atsumeneko uses Japanese-English bilingual notation on all cards and instructions.

Name: Escape from Danger Dungeon
Description: Escape From Danger Dungeon, a co-operative board game based on the Tunnels and Trolls RPG system. Can your band overcome the foes and traps which block its way? Can your band discover an exit before being buried alive? Can your band avoid squabbling over the loot?  you can find out!

Name: Robot Boxing League
Description:
An arena fighting deck builder in a world where robots have replaced human boxers. Choose one of six characters each with unqiue themes, abilities, and starting decks. When you pick your fighter select one of 5 game modes to play in ranging from solo up to a three vs three mode.

The game is divided into two phases the battle and market phases. During the battle phase you play cars at the same time as your opponent. These can range from dealing damage, moving your robot, or blocking your opponent. Once each player has no more cards to play it goes to the Market Phase.

During the market phase you gain credits used to buy from or alter the market. Use your credits to add more cards to your deck, Upgrade your robot, or clean the market.

During gameplay you can earn titles to gain more credits or other bonuses. Don't fret if you get to zero health. Each robot can reboot and continue the fight. Be wary though each reboot has negative consequences on your robot.

Will you be the next RBL Champion?

Name: Dodos Riding Dinos: Chicken Warfare Promo Card
Description: This promo was included with the Kickstarter Exclusives that were delivered for War for Chicken Island.

Name: Countaloupe
Description:
Your goal in Countaloupe is to rid yourself of slice cards as quickly as possible, and whoever clears their plate first wins.

Each player starts with slices numbered 1-16. On a turn, you roll 3-5 dice (depending on your current top slice) and the chance die. After your roll, if any single die or the sum of any number of dice matches your top slice, you remove it; keep removing slices as long as the numbers add up. If, for example, you rolled 1, 2, 5 at the start of the game, you could remove the 1, 2 & 3 slices.

You now either end your turn or roll again. If you roll again and fail to remove a slice, you must place slice cards back on your deck as a penalty.

The chance die may give you the opportunity to swap decks with another player — or force you to swap with whoever has the largest deck! Alternatively, you might gain the Nope! token and use it to block a deck, whether to keep an opponent from removing cards from it or to protect your deck from being stolen.

Countalope can also be played as a multi-round game, with players scoring 1 point per card removed, with a game ending when someone has 16 points. Whoever reaches 100 points first wins.

Name: Killers: The Card Game
Description:
To begin the game, you deal out your stable of 5 infamous killers to each player. On your turn, you will draw a victim card, decide which killer will abduct the victim, roll a die to determine if the abduction is successful, and then roll for the kill. During this time you will be able to use special weapon cards or scenario cards to effect gameplay.

At the end of all players turns, the police will come around to investigate any evidence left, by a dice roll, or apprehend any killers with 3 or more found evidence tokens.

The game is won when one player reaches 10 kills or is the last killer standing.

Part RPG, Part Collectible, All Card Game... this may be the last game you ever play...

Name: M.A.S.H.
Description:
MASH has been brought back from the past and transformed into a hilariously fun, adult party game! A quick 10 to 20-minute game is perfect for anytime you want to play.

Thousands of different futures are possible since MASH includes 300 Fate Cards in 6 unique categories and 40 Scenario Cards, making the game endlessly playable!

Players lay down your picks under the MASH and the fortunista picks their favorite and you get points if yours is picked.  The player with the highest points wins the game.

Includes: 16 Mystery Dry Erase Fate Cards, 1 Mystery Dry Erase Scenario Card, 1 Spiral Dry Erase Card, 300 Fate Cards, 40 Scenario Cards, 1 MASH Banner Board, 4 Mash Tokens, 6 Dry Erase Markers

Name: The Game of Life / Pay Day
Description: The Game of Life and Pay Day in one tin.

Name: Deluxe Domino Dice
Description: In Deluxe Domino Dice, each player in turn rolls up to seven domino-style dice — imagine two six-sided dice connected into a rectangular shape — and tries to place as many of them as possible following standard domino rules. The more dice you place, the more points you collect. You can re-roll once during your turn to try to place more dice, but if you can't place any, then you score nothing for that entire turn.

Name: Endurance: The Game – 24h Le Mans
Description:
During 6 intensive rounds, draw and play cards to score points that represent your lead in the race. If you choose to draw a card, then you have to play a card from your hand.

Watch your Engine !
If you collect 3 or more Overheating Points in a round, you trigger an Engine Overheating, and score zero point for this round.

Sometimes, it is better to have a pit stop during a round. Your score falls to zero, but you lose all your Overheating Points and you can still play to regain a few points before The round ends.

The 24 Hours of the Mans is an endurance race: The winner is the player that manages to keep their engine running until The finish Line!

Name: Space Flickers
Description:
Space Flickers is a competitive flicking game, where player compete in an intergalactic golf tournament, held on hostile aliens planets. 
Player bid on how many strokes it will take them to compete a course and gain bonus points for meeting targets.
Players will have to contend with obstacles, weather events, player special powers and much more.
The course is made up of modular board pieces, which combine to form hundreds of possible courses. The game also comes with buildable 3D obstacles, player characters card, event card and custom flicking pieces.

Name: Guardian & Thieves
Description:
Work hard, build a career, save in order to ensure a prosperous life for your family - this is the path that you have been recommended to follow. But if you stole a treasure, wouldn't the result be the same with much less effort? During your journey, you hear of dungeons, filled with treasures, guarded by golems who tirelessly patrol their dark corridors. How to miss such an opportunity? All you need are companions to act as a diversion while you collect the treasures and you will be "set for life"!

Each player chooses a unique character and use of cunning to pass under the nose of the guardian, embodied by OLEM. Take turns using your moves and actions to explore the dungeon and implement your strategy. But beware! If the Guardian hears you or spots your torchlight, he will tirelessly pursue you to try to imprison you!

Guardian and Thieves integrates the robot and board and takes advantage of the connection to the smartphone. Connect your phone to your speakers to fully enjoy the background music and let OLEM transport you, which reacts to your actions.

On their turn, a player moves his thief from 0 to 5 tiles and can perform 1 of several actions. But beware, some of these actions can aler t the golem to your presence!

The players win if they succeed to bring at least one treasure to the dungeon entrance.

Name: Motif: Expansion Deck
Description: A set of 52 Motif cards.

Name: Venari
Description:
An abstract strategic battle to capture your opponent's soldiers!

In Venari, your goal is to capture two of your opponent’s soldiers.

The rules are very simple:


    You have 4 soldiers on the board.
    Each turn, you choose to move 1 to 4 spaces.
    One of your soldiers moves, space to space, the chosen distance along the paths.
    Try and trap your opponent’s soldier so they can’t move, and capture them.
    Capture two soldiers to win the round.


However, there are some restrictions to consider:


    You select how far to move on the Movement Track using your token, so there will only be 2 of the 4 options available at a time.
    You must move exactly the number of spaces selected.
    You cannot move through any occupied spaces, and you cannot backtrack and retrace your steps within a turn.


If at the end of a turn a soldier has no valid moves (because every adjacent space is occupied), they have been captured.

If you capture 2 soldiers, you win the round.

Win two rounds, and you are the victor!

—description from the publisher

Name: Rolling Stock
Description:
A railway roll-and-write for 2 to 8 players

The six cities are in need of rail service, and it’s up to you to build the connections!

Roll the dice to find out what to build and where, take on contracts to connect cities, and build the longest connection you can.

Try and complete all your contracts before one player connects all six of their cities,and ends the game!

In Rolling Stock, up to 8 players compete to build the best railway networks.

Each round, the two custom railway dice are rolled.


    Choose a rail shape from one die, and draw it into a space of the terrain type from the other die.
    Or, use the numbers on the dice to take a contract to connect two cities.
    Add a station to connect multiple rail lines, or to fill in a tricky space.


Play continues until one player:


    connects all their cities together, or
    fails to make a move.


Then it’s one final round, and time for scoring!

—description from the publisher

Name: Tiny Transit
Description:
A pick-up-and-deliver microgame for 1 to 4 players

Manage a railcar on the transit network to move as many passengers to their destinations as you can.
More passengers are arriving all the time, and new stations open as well.
Don’t let a station get overcrowded, or it’s all over!

Tiny Transit is a pick up and deliver game squeezed into a small package.
Each turn you will pick up one or more passengers from your current station, move around the circle of stations to your next destination, and drop off any passengers heading there for points.
Drop off 3 or more passengers, and a new station is added to the network!
Then, new passengers arrive, and four more cubes are added into play.

Once someone has earned 30 or more points, or a station has no room for new cubes and becomes overcrowded, the game ends. Will you have the highest score and win the game?

—description from the publisher

Name: Summoner Duel
Description:
A battle of wits for 2 players

You are a wizard, battling for dominance in the Duel Arena using your summoned Beasts. However, the magical abilities of your rival are the equal of your own — you will need to outwit your opponent in order to win. Gain control of eight Flames, and claim victory!

In Summoner Duel, two players compete to control the board. Each turn, both players choose two magic stones, and the combined result determines the current player’s movement options. Move one of your two Beasts around the board, and try to claim a space or defeat an opponent’s Beast.

You will have twelve turns to claim eight Flames, or eliminate your opponent!

—description from the publisher

Name: Creature Crèche
Description:
Manage a daycare centre for mythological monsters in this card drafting game for 2 to 6 players.

Welcome to Creature Crèche, a daycare centre for mythological monsters.

Your job is to arrange a room full of creatures as they arrive, and keep them happy, which isn’t an easy task — not all monsters play nicely with others!

Creature Crèche is a card drafting game for 2 to 6 players.

Players simultaneously play a creature onto one end of their line of cards, making sure they don't scare away their neighbours, while trying to arrange them so that everyone is as happy as possible.

Some creatures have special effects that can help you in your task, or make life more difficult for you… or your opponents…

The game is super easy to get started — just shuffle the 52 card deck, deal everyone 8 cards, and you’re ready to go. And a round can be played in just 5 minutes, so it’s a great filler!

—description from the publisher

Name: Slipstream Pocket
Description:
A delivery race for 2 to 4 players
For the fastest deliveries in town, you can depend on the Witch Academy Courier Service!

As a junior witch, you are racing to complete your delivery route the fastest. You must fly to each town location in the correct order for your delivery route, The witch who completes their route and returns home first is the winner!

Slipstream Pocket is a card game that is played as a tabletop game.

Each player controls a witch, and is given a delivery route and five Flight cards to move them around the table. Six town locations are randomly placed in the centre, and you must place your Flight cards down in a pattern that moves your witch over each location in the correct order.

As you play your cards, your movement options become restricted, until you pick up cards from the tail of your slipstream. Plan your flight carefully!

If you can overlap your witch onto a slipstream in play, you can follow it for a speed boost and pick up your cards, gaining a big movement advantage!

Can you complete all your deliveries the fastest?

—description from the publisher

Name: Slipstream
Description:
A delivery race for 2 to 6 players
For the fastest deliveries in town, you can depend on the Witch Academy Courier Service!

As a junior witch, you are racing to complete your mail deliveries the fastest. You must fly to four town locations and deliver mail, then return to the Academy. The witch who completes their route and returns home first is the winner!

In Slipstream, each player controls a witch, and has nine transparent Flight tiles to move them around the board. The game board is a map of the town with the eight locations requiring deliveries. At the start of the game, draw two location cards; you must place your Flight tiles down in a pattern that moves your witch over your nominated locations. Each time you complete a delivery, draw another location card.

As you play your tiles, your movement options become restricted, until you pick up tiles from the tail of your slipstream. Plan your flight carefully!

If you can connect your witch’s slipstream to another slipstream in play, you can follow it for a speed boost and pick up your tiles, gaining a big movement advantage!

Can you complete all your deliveries the fastest?

—description from the publisher

Name: Inventory Quest
Description:
A flip-and-write game of inventory management for 1 to 8 players.

You have been summoned by the king for an important quest, but the road to the castle is long and dangerous — make sure you pack well!

In Inventory Quest, your task is to prepare a backpack full of supplies to help you on your journey to the castle.

Draw your chosen selection of items onto your dry erase player board, then draw 16 cards from the Journey deck to reveal the challenges you’ll face along the way. Erase your supplies as they are used up… will you survive to the end of the journey with the most gems to win?

There are six types of items you can add to your backpack:

    Food, consumed as you travel
    Rope, to cross various hazards
    Potions, for healing
    Swords and Bows, for fighting and hunting
    Shields, to protect against damage


The most important rule to remember when packing, is that you can only access items from the top of your bag. Pack your supplies poorly, and you might not be able to use items when you need them! If you get stuck, you can discard the blocking items; and if you’re lucky you might find a shop to buy replacements.

Try not to run out of food… you don’t want to starve before you reach your destination!

—description from the publisher

Name: SpaceShipped: Lockdown
Description:
In an attempt to weed out the criminal elements from Dynasty worlds, the military has set up blockades and checkpoints throughout the sector. While this has made it much harder for smugglers, it has made things more lucrative for the traders who can get past these troops.

This 6-card expansion follows the format of the other expansions with new encounters, character, ship and a new enemy. The new enemy (The Saboteur) moves through the rows of cards and when they get to the end, they will grab an available Xeno Crystal. Timing is everything.

COMPONENTS

     5 Multipurpose cards
     1 Enemy card


SETUP
Set aside the Wealth, Starting Crew, Ship, and Equipment cards from the base game.

Sort the remaining base game cards along with any expansion cards into the following groups: Crew, Ships, Equipment, and Enemies.
Shuffle each group, then randomly draw the following:

     Crew: 3
     Ships: 3
     Equipment: 7
     Enemy: 1


Along with the cards that you set aside, these are the 18 cards you will use to play.

—description from the publisher

Name: Coalitions: Realpolitik
Description:
The Realpolitik Expansion is a standalone game that brings all the great features and mechanics of Coalitions to a lower player count. It’s based on the Austro-Prussian (1866) and Franco-Prussian wars (1871), conflicts that made the unification of German a reality. Players take on the roles of leaders of France, Prussia, Austria and Italy to try to reshape the map of Central Europe to their advantage one more time. The scale of the game may not be as epic as in other expansions or the base Coalitions, but the stakes are high nonetheless!

The Realpolitik Expansion is designed for 1-4 players, with a new solo mode and an emphasis on the competitive 2-player mode in which both players control two nations. The Activator system is modified to fit this mode and the overall theme of the expansion is a bit different – let’s just say, we’re not forgetting to take into account the massive impact of mid-19the century railways.

Realpolitik also introduces more asymmetry between the nations than in the Coalitions base game, from highly militant Prussia and economically strong France, to newly but not fully united Italy, and multi-ethnic Austria.

As with the other standalone expansions, Realpolitik comes with its own set of components, including a new Wheel of War and a new game board.

—description from the publisher

Name: Coalitions: Soldiers of Fortune
Description:
This free for Kickstarter backers expansion introduces 6 special non-aligned generals who broadly represent the rulers of minor non-playable European kingdoms and duchies. These generals control certain scenario-designated territories at the beginning of the game. Any nation who captures one of these territories will be able to employ its general as if it were their own – at least as long as the said territory is garrisoned by that nation.

The expansion could potentially change the balance of power in Europe, granting nations such as Prussia or Austria access to additional and much-needed generals. But will that be enough to offset the French military superiority? Quite possibly!

—description from the publisher

Name: Coalitions: Levée En Masse Expansion
Description:
In the basic solo mode for Coalitions the player takes control of all European nations except France and tries to defeat Napoleon. With this new expansion, it’s the other way around!

La Patrie en Danger! introduces a new, alternate solo mode that allows you to take on the role of Napoleon himself and use the might of his French Empire to dominate Europe! The AI cards in this expansion dictate the moves of the five other nations. They will try to do everything in their power to curtail the Emperor’s ambitions...

—description from the publisher

Name: Hungry Hungry Hippos Launchers
Description:
The Hungry Hungry Hippos Launchers game is a flippin' fast feeding frenzy as players launch plastic watermelons directly into their hippo's mouth. The motorized game unit has the hippos opening and closing their mouths while players continue to fling the melons, hoping to land the most shots. It's fun for kids to press and release the melons from the launcher, and watch each swallowed watermelon roll back down into the scorecard ramp. Like the classic Hungry Hungry Hippos game, this electronic game is fun for boys and girls ages 4 and up. Play it on rainy days, play dates, and Family Game Night.

ELECTRONIC FLIPPIN' FRENZY GAME: Introducing a twist on classic Hungry Hungry Hippos gameplay. In this electronic version of the board game, players race to launch plastic melons into their hippo's mouth
5 IN FOR THE WIN: Who likes watermelon? These hippos do! Each player gets 5 plastic watermelons. Ready, set, launch! The player whose hippo is the first to eat 5 melons wins
PRESS, SLIDE, RELEASE: Press down on the launching tab, slide your finger off the back, and it'll release the melon into the air. Try to get it to land right into your hippo's moving mouth
CHOMP CHOMP: The hippos' mouths open and close, adding an exciting challenge as kids try to get the watermelons into the hippos' mouths. It features Beginner and Expert modes of play
FUN FAMILY GAME: Remember playing the classic Hungry Hungry Hippos board game as a kid? This Hungry Hungry Hippos Launchers motorized game is great for kids' play dates, and rainy day entertainment

—description from the publisher

Name: Necromolds: Monster Battles – Monster Pack 3: Fungix & Petripod
Description:
This Monster Pack expansion for Necromolds: Monster Battles contains two new spellbooks.

Fungix: Use your fallen monsters as fodder to power-up the ravenous Fungix and crush your enemies with mud, bones, and tree rot!

Petripod: Charge undaunted into a barrage of ranged attacks and dig not your foes using Petripod's powerful defense and melee abilities!

—description from the designer

Name: CLACK! Thwack!
Description:
CLACK! Thwack! uses gameplay similar to CLACK!, but with cards replacing the magnetic discs and with each player bearing a suction-cup thwacker that they will use to claim cards.

In the game, you must thwack all the cards in play that match the dice combination rolled. Cards each show three objects on them, with those objects being red, green, or blue in color and an animal, tree, or vehicle in type. If you roll "0 - red", then you slap all the cards that have zero red objects on them; if you roll "2 - animal", then you slap all the cards with exactly two animals on them. If you're correct, you claim the cards, then refill the display to seven cards.

If no cards on display match the die roll, grab the "NO MATCH" tile in the center of the player area. If you're correct, you collect all seven cards; if not, you must give a previously collected card to each other player at the table.

When all the cards have been claimed, whoever has collected the most cards wins.

Name: Flip-Pix!
Description:
In Flip-Pix!. you start with a number of cards in hand, with one side of each card showing images and the other side showing letters.

Everyone plays at the same time. Pick up your cards, then play one of them image side up, then flip your cards over, find a card with the starting letter for that image, then play that card. Be creative to make matches! For an image of a unicorn, you could play a "U" to match "unicorn", an "A" to match "animal", or an "I" to match "imaginary creature". Flip your cards again to find an image that matches a played letter, and continue playing cards and flipping them.

Whoever first plays all of their cards wins!

Name: Necromolds: Monster Battles – Monster Pack 4: Sigurath & Ankropora
Description:
This Monster Pack expansion for Necromolds: Monster Battles contains two new spellbooks.

Ankropora: Bring ruin to your rivals by spewing forth a cascade of anemone quills, starfish fingers, and shark's teeth from the vile Ankropora!

Sigurath: Flip the crimson-eyed golem upside down to radically change its powers and strategically stomp-out your enemies on the map!

—description from the designer

Name: Necromolds: Monster Battles – Monster Pack 2: Batadactyl & Mongeragon
Description:
This Monster Pack expansion for Necromolds: Monster Battles contains two new spellbooks.

Batadactyl: Storm your opponents with deadly speed using a horror of bestial bat and basaltic gargoyle -- The dreaded and corrupt Batadactyl!

Mongeragon: Survive the smash and annoy your adversaries with Mongeragon -- a treasure hoard that keeps coming back to the battle!

—description from the designer

Name: Necromolds: Monster Battles – Monster Pack 1: Veggitoad & Lethydra
Description:
This Monster Pack expansion for Necromolds: Monster Battles contains two new spellbooks.

Veggitoad: Hatched from frogskins, tubers, and swamp fronds, Veggitoad will swarm and destroy your enemies with two unique clay molds!

Lethydra: Lash out with missiles of mutant mosquitos, toad bile, and gator-teeth using Lethydras's deadly triple attack to conquer your foes!

—description from the publisher

Name: Treat Yo Self!
Description:
Because you deserve it! In this fast-paced game of bidding and bluffing, it pays to pamper yourself. Grab tokens, place bids, and buy some gifts for yourself. Don’t get too greedy or else you could go bust. The player that can collect the most valuable and unique items throughout the game wins. Purchase a bubble wrap dance floor, full grain leather keyboard, or even a diamond encrusted hand-mixer in this fun and light family strategy game. Remember, you are beautiful, you are fierce, and you deserve to TREAT YO SELF!

—description from the publisher

Name: No Such Thing as a Free Sandwich
Description:
No Such Thing as a Free Sandwich is a mint tin party game for 2-8 players, ages 13+. Down to their last few slices of bread, players compete with one another in a variety of challenges to make the best (or worst) sandwiches according to a handful of different score categories such as "Taste", "Affordability", "Wow Factor", and more, using a hodgepodge of ingredients.

At the beginning of the game, each player draws 3 ingredient cards to add to their hand. Each ingredient card has different stat categories that affect how desirable an ingredient is for a given Challenge. At the beginning of each round, a Challenge card is drawn. The Challenge card outlines which stat categories each player’s sandwich should have. Players must play a minimum of 1 card for their sandwich. Cards must be played face-down. When all players are done creating their sandwich, the ingredients are revealed and the player with the sandwich best suited to the Challenge wins the round.

The player with the winning sandwich will keep the Challenge card for the round. Once all of the Challenge cards have been played, the player with the most Challenge cards collected wins the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Los Intocables
Description:
Los Intocables is a game of smuggling and chase racing with modular board and houses.

There are 6 board bases to put them together creating a new city each time.
There are different types of cards in a pile: Luckily, record, action, alarm, tip, extra, raid, explosion, incident.
The lucky ones can be kept in hand for later use, the rest are immediately executed and discarded.
There are tiles to place on the board, both police station (secret / fake) and distillery (illegal / fake)
There are 7 buildings, 1 bank, 2 police stations and 2 bars, each building is a player's base.
There are many cars, in cars you can hide tokens as contraband.
The gangsters must obtain as much money as possible through smuggling or theft and the police must intercept them by dismantling distilleries and vehicles
The gangsters win by accumulated money while the policemen do it by the amount of confiscated car-stills.
Control barriers can be placed to prevent exits through certain streets.
Gangsters must flee after delivering contraband or robbing a bank as they are marked until they leave the board.
The strategic placement of the central police and bar buildings and the secret police station and distillery tiles is important as it determines the difficulty of each team.
The police should try to keep distillery tiles away from bars and bars from exits.
The mafia team for their part should try to place the distilleries near the bars and these near the exits of the city to reduce the persecution, always in blocks of buildings and not on the road or street.
The bench is placed by mutual agreement between both teams.
The cars are placed on the board in the module where each player's base is located.
The game progresses as follows, a player draws a card and plays or saves it according to the one that came out, makes a dice roll that resolves how many cars are moving and how much they are moving, there cannot be 2 cars in the same road cell, but it can be overtaken.
The special value die is used to determine how much money is in the bank during a robbery.
The cops must try to intercept all the gangster cars discovered, following a bank robbery or a delivery from a distillery.
When a car passes a secret police station, the police can intercept it by turning the tile and searching the vehicles next to it.
A vehicle with contraband is immediately stopped at the secret police station control and must pay a fine or it is eliminated,
There are letters that give the right to registration and that allow you to see if you are a smuggler or not.
You can also risk losing a police car if you decide to search with a patrol car and there is no contraband, but if there is a shooting of the dice. In the shootout, either party may be arrested / withdrawn or killed depending on the dice rolls and modifier cards played.
You also have to discover and dismantle the distillery tiles, playing the appropriate cards or detect the situation of the secret police station tiles to avoid their controls.
The cards also allow moving the control barriers that close some of the exits of the city, both to one team and another.
The smugglers and thieves achieve their objective as soon as they manage to leave the city and obtain the corresponding economic reward.
The policemen achieve their objectives by preventing the cars from leaving the city, arresting or killing them, and dismantling distilleries.
The game ends when half of the gangsters' troops disappear (cars and / or tiles) or when they manage to accumulate a predetermined amount of money.

Name: The Adventures of Dex Dixon: The Board Game
Description:
The Adventures of Dex Dixon the Board Game is a scenario-based strategy game set in a multi-spoked, inter-dimensional, noir, horror world filled with Paranormal Detectives, Monster Crime Bosses and Vampire Torch-Song Singers. Choose your Boss, recruit your Mugs, assemble your gear, and charge your magical powers. Defeat your opponents and obtain your objective by outwitting them with each characters’ unique abilities. No two game sessions will be the same.

A limited area skirmish game with characters that have specific powers and abilities that can be augmented with cards that you draw throughout the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Heirloom
Description:
This is the story of Elouise Farmer. Elouise was a mother, a pillar of the Littleton farming community, and was known to all in the nine valleys, as Ma. Elouise made a small fortune selling her heirloom selections to the Littleton Market. For decades Elouise was known as a charismatic saleswoman, and an absolute wonder of a farmer. Elouise’s famous heirlooms were known near and far as the best in all of the nine valleys.
Over the years Elouise invested her fortune in the lands surrounding Littleton, and until her recent passing, she was the single greatest land holder in all of the nine valleys.

Elouise’s recent passing was mourned by all around, and her funeral was one for the record books. Every respectable farmer in the nine valleys attended the service, to bid one final farewell to a great matriarch, Elouise Farmer. Ma. Elouise’s recent passing has weighed even more heavily on you and your siblings, and for good reason. She was your Mother. Her passing, not only tears at the fibers of your being, but also places a tremendous burden upon your shoulders.  As her heirs, you and your siblings are now at the forefront of the community’s attention. What will the children of the great Elouise Farmer do with their vast inheritance?

In the game, the players each take on the roll of Elouise Farmer’s grown children. Each beginning the game with a family of their own, and a recent inheritance.

Each play of Heirloom is a snapshot of life on the farm. The players compete by drafting farm hands & development cards, rolling weather dice, sowing seeds, reaping the fruits of their labor, and selling to the Littleton Market! Ultimately, the ‘Farmer’ with the most money at the end of the game wins!

—description from the publisher

Name: Kaboom!
Description:
Kaboom! is a card game for 2 to 6 players. The objective is to collect points after each round.

At each turn a player, after receiving his cards, discards one, there are some special cards that allow you to roll the dice and change the color of the cards. Points are collected when the Kaboom card is discarded. The first option is a Double Kaboom, in which you have two Kaboom cards in hand, which you have either drawn from the draw pile, drawn from an opponent using the Woosh card or received during the deal. The second option is to discard a Kaboom card as your last car

The game ends when a player manages to score 10 points.

Name: Steampunk: Wasteland Chronicles
Description:
Steampunk: Wasteland Chronicles is a strategy tabletop game in the steampunk post-apocalyptic genre with detailed mechanics as well as action selection, area control, resource management and set collection. Choose one of five clans with their own unique skills. Go to the Lab for a vaccine and organize trips to the Rift for energy pods. Get weapons and resources at the Flea Market or try your luck in the Ruins or Mines. Capture the objects that will be most useful in your development! Explore technology and build steam machines!

What does a player do on their turn - the game consists of several phases. In the first phase players decide what do they do on the game board. The second phase is an action phase, when they collect their clan miniatures from the gameboard and take necessary actions. It may need dice roll, or payment, or trading, depending on chosen strategy. In the third phase, they vaccinate their clan and count points. Then the turn goes to the next player and every phase starts all over.

The game ends when either all technology cards are learned or all steam machines are built.

The player with most points after all count wins.

Name: Go Shopping! ( 購物小達人 )
Description:
Get your fists in the air and go shopping! Check your shopping list and put the right items in your shopping basket, and be careful not to lose any unplanned items! At the same time, you should also play the virtue of being kind to others, if you find something that others need, you should be generous to give it back! Free parent-child handbook is included in the game!

Each player takes $10, a shopping basket, a shopping list and a price list.

Players take turns performing Buying items or turning over cards to earn money.

When a player buys all 7 items on the shopping list, the game is over and the player wins and becomes a little shopper!

Name: Sudoku Explorer (數獨探險家)
Description:
Each player takes a Sudoku board, 3 puzzle cards and 6 of each type of adventure.
The puzzle cards are inserted into the Sudoku board and the players begin to solve the puzzle at the same time.
Upon completion of the puzzle, the first player to solve the puzzle correctly receives 3 gems; the second player to solve the puzzle correctly receives 1 gem; and the player who solves the puzzle incorrectly also receives 1 gem after correcting it.
When everyone has completed all 3 puzzle cards, the player with the most gems wins!

Name: 18CZ: Bonus Boards
Description:
Hard bonus boards for putting away stocks and an additional map for a 2-3 player scenario.

Only nine companies remain in the game, three of each size.

There is a third automatic player in the game, whose name is Václav.

Name: Spell Spud
Description:
A long forgotten power has reemerged, a conduit of great magic and ruin. Though dangerous and hot to the touch, you cannot resist the chance to control it. Willing wizards, are you ready to duel your friends to emerge victorious and unlock the secrets hidden within...the Spell Spud???

Spell Spud is a 2-6 player elimination game in which players pass around the hot potato while trying to avoid burning their hands. Cast spells, trap your foes, and be the last wizard standing to gain victory in this easy to learn, but surprisingly deep, card game!

Each player chooses a unique pair of hands to represent themselves. When it’s your turn, you get to choose which hand you hold the potato with. If a Hand is burned, it’s flipped to the ‘Burned’ side. If it’s burned again, it’s out. With two hands, players have a chance to come back if they’ve had a rough start.

The potato is the core of the game. Each player starts their turn with it in their possession, allowing them access to their actions while also placing them at risk of being burned.

Players can take two actions during their turn. You may use an action to draw from the Spell Deck, which holds several useful spells to defend yourself from harm or place your foes into dangerous situations. But, it also costs an action to cast most spells, so think ahead to utilize your actions most effectively.

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Eighth Edition): Codex Adeptus Astartes – Vanguard Space Marines
Description:
The Vanguard Space Marines are the finest reconnaissance and covert warfare troops available to the Adeptus Astartes.  Their ranks filled by pious battle-brothers clad in specialised patterns of Mk X power armour and wielding the deadliest weapons available to the Imperium of Mankind.


     The book contains a structure and history of the Vanguard formations
     A uniform guide and showcase that includes a variety of colour schemes used by Vanguard Space Marines.
     A comprehensive range of datasheets providing tabletop rules for every unit detailed in the codex.
     Army-wide rules content.

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Seventh Edition): Pandorax Campaign
Description:
A planet in the grip of chaos!

In 959 M41, Abaddon the Despoiler led a Chaos incursion fleet to invade the Imperial planet Pythos in the Pandorax star system.  Within days the huge Chaos Space Marine army at his command had overrun the planet and opened a long forgotten Warp portal that unleashed a horde of Daemons upon the world.

In the book you will find:


     The Pandorax Incursion which has a detailed history of the invasion
     A battle report fought on an Imperial spaceship
     A miniature showcase
     Rules of Engagement
     Datasheets

Name: Parcelmen
Description:
Parcelmen is a board game for 1 to 4 players. Here, you can become a delivery driver, planner or a dispatcher – simply anyone involved in delivering a parcel from the sender to recipient. You will be planning routes, organising collections and distributions and doing your best to get your courier company running like clockwork. Whether you succeed will depend on your ability to plan effectively as well as on your ability to improvise and make good use of all your resources!

Players plan to deliver parcel to the right address. A player can choose from 4 actions from drawing new parcels to checking on delayed and undelivered parcels. Players get points for delivering their parcels. The game ends after 5 rounds and the player who scores the most points wins.

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Seventh Edition): Planetary Onslaught
Description:
Invade and Conquer

For the war-torn worlds of the 41st Millenium, the question is not if the invader will come - merely when.  Rumbling into low orbit over far-flung planets, colossal battleships herald their arrival with ground-ripping bombardments.

Planetary Onslaught provides missions and new campaigns that enable you to recreate each stage of an invasion on the tabletop, with one player assuming the role of attacker and one assuming the defender.

It offers new rules for Planetstrikes, Siege Warfare, and Cities of Death.  It also provides datasheets for fortifications and terrain.

Name: BANG! Dynamite Box
Description:
Whether you're a sheriff, a bandit or a brawler of the worst kind, in the Wild West you can only believe in two things: gunpowder and dynamite!
This explosive BANG! box includes 8 legendary expansions, for a disrupting gaming experience!
 What does this official BANG! collectors box contain?


     BANG! (base game)
     BANG! The Great Train Robbery – Expansion
     BANG! Dodge City – Expansion
     BANG! Gold Rush – Expansion
     BANG! Armed & Dangerous – Expansion (including Bloody Mary)
     BANG! Expansion Pack:
         BANG! Wild West Show – Expansion
         BANG! The Valley of Shadows – Expansion
         BANG! High Noon + A fistful of cards – Expansion
    
     The Stick of Dynamite – To be used in a game variant
     34 Wooden Bullets
     8 premium Dual Layer Boards
     Extra Content Slot
     Extra Cards: Annie Versary (from BANG! 10th Anniversary), Emiliano (from BANG! 20th Anniversary), and special characters and cards from BANG! The Bullet!: Uncle Will, Johnny Kisch, Claus "The Saint", "New Identity", and "Handcuffs"
     A single book for the rules (40 pages, 12.5×18 cm two-sided full-colour glossy stapled)



(please note there is also a product called "BANG! Dynamite Box: Storage Box and Accessories" which does NOT contain the games, but contains the premium Boards, the Wooden Bullets, and the Stick of Dynamite.)

—description from the publisher

The box, besides being filled with goodies, has a sleeve added that provides the coloured BANG! on its front and a description of the contents on its back.

All cards are 56×87 mm.
Families: Versions & Editions: Big Box Versions of Individual Games

Name: Emojo Dojo
Description:
A great new spin on the classic card game, "War".  Martial Art Emoji themed, multi-player all out war with special battle cards and situations. Ten different Emoji's from white belt to black belt battle it out along with the wise Sensei.

Up to five players battle it out to win the battle cards. The last person standing in the 'dojo' is the winner. There are three types of "FACE-OFF" cards; Standard, Roundhouse and Tag-team, each keeps the battles interesting. Several special circumstances such as:
Double Trouble: Separate battles take place at the same time. 
Lucky Strike: All cards in consecutive order (4,5,6,7), lowest card wins.
Loco Mojo: All players advance to the next level battle.
Go!-Low: Two cards are the same rank but lower than the highest card (3,3,10), The high card has the option to  surrender or join in the battle. These make each hand dynamic and exciting.

Emojo Dojo has three levels of play; Sly's Battle (Easy), Basic Play and Sensei Rules (complex).

The thing everyone hates about WAR is watching two people exchange cards for hours. Emojo Dojo has "Elimination Rules" that reveals a quick winner as the players get knocked out. This keeps games quick and everyone interested and engaged.

Name: Cheddar Blitz
Description:
Fast-paced racing game! All players race at the same time to complete five unique Challenges. Players scramble to match their BLiTZ Row to their Challenge cards while preventing others to match theirs. Special "FLiP OUT" cards forces any player to swap out their current Challenge card and start over.

Each player starts with 5 challenge cards (top one face up), two round BLiTZ cards in their hand and four face up on the table. There are 2 draw piles and a discard area. Play begins when the dealer says "Blitz". The play action is DRAW, DISCARD, DOWN. Players (simultaneously, not taking turns) draw a round Blitz card, then discards (face up) a card that they don't need. This card becomes available for other players. Then places one down from their hand to fill in the row. When a player matches their BLiTZ row to their Challenge card, they yell "CHEDDAR" and all play pauses while they reset the board and turn over a new challenge card.
You can use any number of wild cards and can rearrange your row at any time. The winner is the one who completes all five Challenges and Shouts "CHEDDAR!"

Unique colorful round BLiTZ cards highlights the special Emoji on each card.

Name: Old Bill
Description:
Build a den of thieves with matching pairs, but avoid Old Bill by outwitting and outwitting the other Masterminds! The player who gets the most matching pairs of thieves (two cards with the same picture) wins the game, but watch out for Old Bill! If you end up with him in your hand, he will remove one of your matches!

Players draw cards and either play or trade them to make matches. Old Bill will reduce some of your matches.

The game continues until a player takes the last card from the deck. This is now the last round, in which each player makes a final move.

Players now count the number of pairs they have managed to make in their area for the score. If a player ends up with any number of old bills in their hand, they must discard one of their scoring pairs. The player with the most pairs of thieves wins the game! If there is a tie, add up the ranks across your paired pairs, counting the pair's rank only once, not both Thieves within a pair. Whoever has the highest total score wins! If there is still a tie, the win is split.

You can also pull this box out for a classic game of Old Maid (with ole' Bill) or Memory with the whole family.

– description from the publisher

Name: Champions!
Description:
Let the Tournament begin! You and an opposing commander shall face off in a battle of wits for the prestigious title of Royal Commander!

In Champions!, two players will take turns upgrading and commanding legions of warriors to defeat their opponent in battle.

The game is played on an imagined 6 row by 3 column board, with either player picking one of the far back rows as their base row.

Each turn has two phases:
1. Movement: you will move your units around the board (rotate, move, fight). Cards move one space per turn.
2. Reinforce: you will summon a new scout or upgrade a scout to a champion (recruit, upgrade).

You win the battle, and the title of Royal General, if you move one of your units into your opponent’s base row.
Families: Contests: Button Shy Game Design Contests and Challenges

Name: Stacks
Description:
Bluffing, to a science.
Stacks is a 15-card, 3-4 player bluffing game where the stakes are high and they keep raising.

Overview
Play cards each turn to increase the point value of your Stack. Make a bid that matches the value of all the cards in your Stack. Keep raising the Bid each turn to stay in the round. Get caught lying, and your opponent takes everything. Beware the dastardly -10 card, or use it yourself to catch your opponents by surprise.

Each round of Stacks is about a minute long, from dealing the cards to scoring the points. Play a few rounds at lunch or a few hundred.

Name: Aves
Description:
In Aves (Spanish for “Birds”), players take on the roles of hungry birds. Seek out the best grubs to score points and gain special powers. Outwit your opponents and rule the skies!

The goal of Aves is to score the most points by eating grubs.
At the end of the game, the player with the highest score wins!

Players draw cards to move, eat grubs, collect bonus points, and affect others players moves.

The game ends the moment the Grubs deck runs out.

All players count up their points as well as bonus points from set bonuses or special rules. The player with the highest score wins! If there is a tie, the player who ate the most Grubs wins.

Name: Panama
Description:
Our fleet’s halfway around the world. It’ll be smooth sailing once we’re through the famously crowded Panama Canal. But another famous Captain has accidentally been scheduled for the same day!

In Panama, you must use your fleet’s special abilities to push your ships through the Panama Canal before your opponent!

Each player controls a fleet of 9 ships. Each ship has a special power that makes it unique. On your turn, pick one of your ships and move it one space per your ship's special abilities.

To win, move six of your nine ships through the Panama canal, past all of your opponent’s ships, and off the opposite end of the board, past all of your opponent’s ships.
Families: Contests: Button Shy Game Design Contests and Challenges

Name: Pandemie Poker
Description:
In the humorous and instructive card game Pandemic Poker, everyone wants to protect themselves from the infectious viruses. Mouth and nose protection or disinfectants will benefit you and a few rolls of toilet paper can also help you out.

It is important to keep your distance, also with regard to the playing cards: the cards have different values â€‹â€‹and may only be placed on the discard pile with a certain (number) distance. Each card has an additional function that can have an advantage or disadvantage for you or your fellow players. Whoever manages to discard all of his hand cards wins the game.

Pandemic Poker is Uno with distance rules and strange special abilities. No cards that are directly adjacent to it are placed on the stack, only those values â€‹â€‹may be placed that are indicated as permitted on the previous card. After all, we have to keep our distance. In addition, there are special cards that I can play at any time if I have two of the same type. So I suspend or draw cards. Alternatively, I also get rid of CoVid19 cards or swap cards in my hand. And speaking of CoVid19 cards. If we have three of them in hand, we are eliminated from the game. Whoever gets rid of all of his hand cards first wins.

Name: Kreuz-Mühle
Description:
Each player has 12 playing pieces of one color. In the first stage of the game players take turns placing their pieces on the intersections of the board, attempting to make a connected line of three inside one of the five squares on the board. A line with pieces in more than one square doesn't count. Once all the pieces have been placed, the players may slide them. Whenever a player makes a line of three, he removes an opponent's piece of his choice, which is not part of a line of three. When one player has only three pieces left, he is allowed to move any piece from any point on the board to any other point. As soon as one player is left with only two pieces, his opponent wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Crazy Golf
Description:
Cards are lined up to create mini-golf holes, players will roll dice to try and achieve the lowest score. There are different routes to each hole - which route to take is up to the player. The player will call out which route they intend on taking, then roll dice to determine whether or not the conditions are met for them to continue along that path.

Holes consist of 4-6 cards lined up, with difficulty differences depending on which side of the card is used.

The game is a mix between dice rolling, risk vs reward, and mini-golf.

Name: Crowded Kitchen
Description:
Race your opponents in this lightning fast, real time, set collection card game. Fight over limited ingredients in the Kitchen. Organize your cook space. Plan ahead by storing ingredients in your Pantry. Compete against other chefs to complete recipes as fast as you can and earn the prestigious Excellence Stars.

There are no turns. All players play at the same time.

Players attempt to complete Recipe cards as quickly as possible using Ingredients taken from the Kitchen. Each player has their own deck of recipes, but the ingredients in the Kitchen are shared. When players complete a Recipe, they set that recipe card along with any ingredients used to complete it aside in a completed pile. Players then reveal a new recipe from their deck.

When a player has no cards left to draw from their Recipe deck, the round ends. Players score one point for each completed Recipe and Ingredient used to complete those recipes (ignoring Sketchy Substitutes). The player with the most points, wins the round and earns a star card. Each star earned increases the difficulty for that player in future rounds by limiting the number of recipes they can have active. The first player to collect the required amount of stars, wins.

Name: ゆるキャン△〜どこでもテント張り！(Yurucamp Tents Everywhere!)
Description:
In this 1-4 player game based on the hit manga "laid-back camp", you want to get your tents all set up and ready for camping!

In gameplay terms, this means players lay out a pyramid of 28 cards (one card at a time) from a deck of 36 cards (4x each of 0-8) by using math to make sure that every card can be played correctly. that is, each card played in the pyramid must either be the sum or the difference between the two cards below it (playing a 8 or 2 if they respectively are more than 8 or less than 0).

Players win the game when one one player can a play card or the team cooperatively creates a 7 layer pyramid.

Name: The Game オバケやしきのすうじのアクマ (Demons of Numbers)
Description:
THE GAME ã‚ªãƒã‚±ã‚„ã—ãã®ã™ã†ã˜ã®ã‚¢ã‚¯ãƒž is a new incarnation of The Game where players struggle to seal away ghosts and other creatures lurking about a haunted mansion.â€¨â€¨

The premise of the game is that players are naughty children who enter a haunted house and accidentally open a book that releases a host of demons. They must work to seal these escapees back into the book. However, the demons are actually Demons of Numbers and therefore the players cannot speak in numbers (or else be cursed and die).

The basic gameplay is the same as The Game, where players work together to discard all cards into four piles depending on the UP/DOWN conditions of each pile. During their turn, players discard either a larger or smaller value card(s) as appropriate. Afterwards, players refill their hand.â€¨â€¨

Players cannot share the numbers of the cards in their hand with other players but must find ways to collaborate in order to effectively place cards in the four piles so that all players can have zero cards in their hand at the end of the game.

If there is an exact difference of 10 between the card a player discards and the last card in a pile, the player is free to play the card regardless of the UP/DOWN direction of the pile.â€¨â€¨

In Demons of Numbers, there are also six types of effect cards (which are number cards with an effect written at the bottom): Reverse, Skip, Short, Draw 2, Silence, and Declaration of Death.

There are three types of ending results for the game: Total victory, victory, and loss.

--

Additional Information:

This all new game builds upon the original The Game with additional rules for a spookishly fresh gameplay experience.

Unlike The Game Extreme which added rules to make gameplay even more challenging for players, Demons of Numbers offers a more interactive, conversational experience. The new design also allows for up to 6 players.

Familiar “effects” are added to the game to give it a more UNO-esque familiarity. In fact, these changes have earned this version of the game the nickname “The Game Junior” by the original publisher.

The increased player number, new rules, and random events make it more difficult for players to find a repeatable pattern to beat the game and result in a making Demons of Numbers more of a “party game” for all ages and for gamers and non-gamers alike.

The designer, 326, felt that the original The Game had a title that was really not ideally optimized for easy internet searches, as well as artwork that would make it for children to convince their parents to purchase the game for them. He wanted to take a new approach and was able to find a willing partner in Arclight Games.

Illustrations are also by 326.

Name: Edge of Darkness: Emissaries of the Vale
Description:
Welcome to the Vale, home of the staunch Druids of the Clans.

For too long have the Realm of Humans and the Vale been at odds. As the Blight threatens to extend its influence deep into the Valley of Life, the Druids finally decide to set aside their distrust of humans borne of the unholy union of the Necromancer King and the sister of Gaia, the Crone. They reach out for help, pleading for appeasement and in return, druid and humans from all creeds (Aegis, Dunestar, Coldharbor) finally stand united. Reclaim what was once lost and destroy the Blight once and for all!

Emissaries of the Vale is the third expansion to Edge of Darkness, and furthers the variety offered by its unique blend of worker placement and card crafting to help you bring your guild to victory thanks to its 13 unique location boards and associated advantages. Send your agents broken peace with the Druids at the Stem of the Clans, find and defeat the mighty Betrayer of the Vale in the depths of the Untamed Forest and marvel at the myriad of creatures living under the protection of Gaia in this fully compatible expansion.

—description from the back of the box

Name: Minigolf Designer: Putt of No Return Expansion
Description:
This is a mini expansion for Minigolf Designer and requires the base game to play. Inside, you will find 5 double layered score sheets to replace the original ones and new gameplay additions: 4 new clients (two women and two men) to renew the client whim flavor and 24 new tiles, including tricky tiles with 3 red and 1 green edge.

Here are how the new clients score:
- Mrs Noreturn likes directional tiles (the tiles with a white arrow). Before, these tiles were just penalizing you if you placed them in the wrong direction, now Mrs Noreturn will actually reward you for each arrow in the right direction.
- Mr Intheway gives points for a tile feature that was not exploited yet in the game: obstacles.
- Mrs Camper likes the grass tiles, which will be perfect if you chose her with Mr Short, but will be more challenging with Mr Long.
- Mr Perfect will satisfy perfectionist players, as he gives you points for each perfectly respected constraint (3 victory points for playability, 4 for the land constraint, 5 for the circuit constraint, and 6 for the par constraint).

-- Publisher description

Name: Titles
Description:
Titles is a movie-themed atmosphere and general culture game in which you will have to guess a movie title from a card.

At the start of the game, each player draws 5 cards and 1 other card is put in the center. On your turn, you had to choose between "play 1 of your cards then pick a new one" or "discard 1 to 5 cards and draw as much".

The game ends, when a player reaches 30 points. At the end of the game, we end the round so that everyone has played the same number of times, and the one with the most points wins the game.

Name: Suits Me Dice Game
Description:
Suits Me is a dice game that is played with five custom suited dice: each die displaying the four standard card suits on the four side faces and 50 points displayed on the top and bottom faces.

Players have three dice rolls during each turn to accumulate as many points as possible, which are added to their total game score. Points are awarded for various suited combinations of dice rolled, plus additional points for each die rolled showing a number value. As the name of the game implies... suited dice rolls offer the most lucrative scoring opportunities and the first player to reach the target score wins the game.

Name: Find & Seek Scavenger Hunt Card Game
Description: In this scavenger hunt game, players flip over cards and rush to find items that match the description on the card. There are 3 ways to play, but whoever finds the specified number of items first is the winner.

Name: Color-Coded: The Violet Vendetta
Description:
In Color-Coded's first ever expansion, players are given new 'Play' cards which adds interesting twists to the game because now, your decoded cards fall prey to The Violet Vendetta!

Color-Coded: The Violet Vendetta adds 20 more color cards and 20 more 'Play' cards to the Star Deck.

Name: The Witcher: Old World – Mounted Eredin Miniature
Description: Mounted Eredin is an exclusive alternative sculpted miniature and a special Card for the Wild Hunt expansion that was given to Kickstarter backers who backed on the first day of the campaign.

Name: Color-Coded: The Orange Obstacle
Description: In the second expansion to Color-Coded, players now face an entirely new challenge in the form of Obstacles which add on new tasks and hindrances when trying to decode their Code cards!

Name: Color Coded: The Grey Guild
Description: In the third expansion of Color-Coded, players now try to vie for the favor of the mysterious Grey Guild. To do so, players must now work as teams of two against another to see who is worthy to join their ranks by decoding six codes together, decoding new Wild Codes and scoring Grey Bonuses to help aid in their endeavors. Which team is worthy to join the Guild?

Name: Journée de merde
Description:
Your day started off pretty well but by adding "shitty day" cards to your story, you find that it just gets more and more rotten.

Accumulate awkward and embarrassing situations to have the worst shitty day by picking or placing a card.
The winner is the player with the high score (points are written on each card). 
An aperitif game to spend hilarious evenings with friends.

Name: Armada: Seas Aflame Supplement
Description:
Ahoy there captains. Seas Aflame is a supplement book for Mantic's game of epic naval warfare: Armada. Take your games of Armada to the next level! With ten new scenarios, rules for fliers and fortifications as well as a full campaign system, the book also expands on the naval background in the world of Pannithor and introduces the next wave of fleets to be released for the Armada game.

Seas Aflame is an exciting new 72-page supplement for Armada. Inside you'll find:


     new rules for fliers – take the battle to the skies
     rules for adding coastal defences to your games
     new upgrades
     10 new scenarios
     campaign rules that will see your fleet develop over time
     background on upcoming fleets (elves, Twilight Kin, Salamanders, Northern Alliance and Varangur)


—description from the publisher

Name: Das ÖVA-Spiel
Description: The players start at space 1. The first to reach space 65 wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. At the beginning of the game and after the 4th turn the players have to pay an insurance fee.

Name: Bingo Island
Description:
Welcome to Bingo Island, an island full of fabulous riches. As a family on this small island, you must grow and harvest resources, befriend animals, and search for treasures.

On your turn, spin the wheel, then place a resource on your field. When you complete a row, column, or diagonal, shout "Bingo!", then collect the appropriate tools and make friends with animals. Finally, search the sand for treasures containing gold coins while trying to avoid the crabs.

As soon as an islander collects four treasures, the game ends, then the islander with the most gold coins wins.

Name: Federation Commander: Scenario Log
Description:
Scenarios form a great deal of the history of the Star Fleet Universe. These scenarios were originally published in Captain's Log #32 (which saw the introduction of Federation Commander) through Captain's Log #50. Here you will find scenarios written originally for Star Fleet Battles (and adapted for Federation Commander) and those written new for Federation Commander.

While many of the scenarios are written for two players, you will find some written for three, four, or even five players. There are classic duels with some twists, missions, and two Juggernaut scenarios.

You will need Federation Commander ship cards and rules to play these scenarios; however, you can also simply enjoy reading about the various parts of Star Fleet Universe history.

Name: AgroChemineer
Description:
AgroChemineer is an industrial resource management game for 2 to 4 Players that features simultaneous gameplay and an innovative new economy mechanic.

Players buy, manage, then sell different resources until the end of the game year (when a player reaches 10 points)

The player with the most points wins.

With more mouths to feed around the globe, the business of getting the most out of crops, Agrochemistry, is a growing field. The materials market changes each season, so a player must wait until the time is right to purchase resources, research the perfect fertilizer blend, mix up the ingredients in reactors, and fill orders while the demand is at it's highest!

Name: Fog of Love: Love on Lockdown
Description:
Is your relationship too comfortable or are you just unable to go anywhere else?

Love on Lockdown is an expansion to the critically acclaimed, Fog of Love board game. Love on Lockdown tells the story of a couple who find themselves locked inside together for months on end with nothing to do. (How did we ever come up with this idea!?)

While on lockdown, you'll have more to manage than most couples - like your boredom and how reckless you're acting about the Threat. Coping with cabin fever will make or break the relationship - if you can even keep it up that long to begin with!

Navigate a branching storyline that switches paths based on your choices.
    Choose the fate of your relationship from 8 new destinies
    Explore 45 fun, new Scene cards all concerned with life, love, and happiness on the (literal) inside.

Name: Devil in the Wilderness: A Game of Witchcraft, Puritans, and New England Indians
Description:
It is 1689 and King Philip's War, between the Northern English colonies and the Native peoples, is over. Atrocities have been committed by both sides. But the fighting isn't done -- five factions still vie for control of New England...

Devil in the Wilderness is a colonial gothic-horror skirmish game for 1-5 players. A typical game plays in 2 hours and needs a 4x4 game surface with village terrain and 10-15 miniatures per side.

The game can be played using the cards and the traditional rule-book, or with an online game app, available through Application of Force, which works on PCs, smart phones, or tablets. (Both games use the same rules, miniatures, terrain, and dice.)

—description from the publisher

Name: Federation Commander: Scenario Log 2
Description:
Scenarios form a great deal of the history of the Star Fleet Universe. These scenarios (over 50 of them!) were originally published in Communique #1 through Communique #85. Here they are gathered into one spot as you requested.

Earlier scenarios have been updated to the current format. More options have been added to some of the scenarios. Even better, there is an index by empire involved and the number of players.

You will need Federation Commander ship cards and rules to play these scenarios; however, you can also simply enjoy reading about the various parts of Star Fleet Universe history.

Name: Suspicious Brew
Description:
Story:
Our reigning emperor is obsessed with two things: war and herbal tea. In times of war, we are largely free. Since our nation is at peace, we are all forced to spend every waking moment serving the Emperor tea. It's worse than death. It's monotonous. So, we've all decided: The Emperor must die.

So...ahem. We challenge you to a duel!

Experience:
Suspicious Brew is a bluffing game where you and your royal court are locked in a tea-time battle of wits, serving up a deserving death to the Emperor as you compete for the title of “tricksiest hero of all.” The game gets really intriguing and silly when you start choosing your secret agendas based on the evolving social dynamics of the court, knowing your friends know that you know they know you know how they play each role, and that they will use that against you, and you know it! When that happens, you feel determined to outwit them, or to just plain old lie your pants off to thwart their efforts!

Interesting elements:
Your Agendas are chosen, not dealt randomly. The role of Emperor has all the authority to make decisions, and the players they rely on have all the first hand information and are the only ones who can influence the outcome of each round. Each Secret Agenda has a vague alignment, but everyone is in it for themselves, so cooperation outside of your "faction" can be valuable. Everyone has the chance to play the Emperor once before the Emperor dies. The emotional stakes are lower than many other bluffing games, because the narrative being played out is absurd, and person who gets screwed over ultimately is not any of the players but the fictional Emperor.

This game is certified non-toxic to friendships.

—description from the designer
